title: Hong Kong Dials Back One of World’s Longest Covid-19 Quarantines
sub_head: Arriving travelers will spend two weeks in isolation from Feb. 5, shortening stays that have been criticized by business groups
body:
HONG KONG—Officials shortened one of the world’s longest quarantine requirements for travelers arriving in Hong Kong to two weeks from three following pressure from international business groups over the city’s zero-Covid policies.
Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam said Thursday the order, effective from Feb. 5, was made based on scientific considerations and as the Omicron variant of the coronavirus becomes the dominant strain in more countries.
